title: Formula for Displacement Relative to the Air Mass
text: d' $$=$$ v't, where d' is the displacement relative to the air mass, v' is the velocity relative to the air, and $$t$$ is the time in seconds.

title: Substituting Into the Equation
text: Plug the values in for d' $$=$$ v't.

title: Velocity Relative to the Air
text: What is v', the velocity relative to the air?

title: Converting Minutes to Seconds
text: In the problem, we are told that Bryan flew $$169$$ minutes. In order to find $$t$$, we must convert $$169$$ minutes to seconds (remember that $$1$$ minute $$=$$ $$60$$ seconds). What answer do you get?

subHints.title: Calculating the Conversion from Minutes to Seconds
subHints.text: To convert $$169$$ minutes to seconds, you must solve for $$169\times60$$ because $$1$$ minute $$=$$ $$60$$ seconds. What answer do you get?

title: Final Plugged-In Equation in Meters
text: The plugged-in equation for d' $$=$$ v't is d' $$=$$ $$(5.53)(10140)$$. What is the answer in meters?

title: Converting Meters to Kilometers
text: The last step is to convert the displacement relative to the air mass from meters to kilometers (hint: $$1$$ meter $$=$$ $$0.001$$ kilometers). Remember to round your final answer to the nearest tenths place.

title: Calculating the Conversion from Meters to Kilometers
text: To convert meters to kilometers, we must calculate $$56074.2\times0.001$$ because Bryan traveled $$56074.2$$ meters relative to the air mass and $$1$$ meter $$=$$ $$0.001$$ kilometers. What answer do you get? Round to the nearest tenths place.
